Consumer_Text: Last year, I enrolled for Spotify Student Premium at a discounted rate of $6 per month. On February 28th 2025, this plan was changed to regular ‚ùùpremium individual‚ùù and has been charging me $12/month for the past 5 month. I was not notified of this change by Spotify, and was unaware that my ‚ùùstudent discount‚ùù has expired. I have been a student throughout the entirety of this period, and thereby eligible for the discount. Is there any way the difference in subscription rates can be refunded to me for the past 5 months (i.e. a $6 surplus per month for 5 months = a $30 refund)? I'm requesting a retroactive refund for the past 5 month where I was overcharged. NO Yes Hi Ambica Yes, that is all correct. I'm requesting a partial refund for the period in between 2/28/25 and 6/28/26 since I was a student and thereby eligible for the discount. This is evidenced by my success in renewing for discount for an additional year (which I did today). I would have done this sooner, but just now become aware that I was being overcharged for the past 5 months. 6/28/25* Is there any way you could add 5 months of the Individual Premium to my account? This is because I was overcharged by $6 per month, and am only required to pay $6 per month as a result of my student discount. As this occured for 5 months, it seems fair I recieve 5 months as compensation. I understand that you are trying to compromise and I can appreciate that. However, I am adamant that I receive 5 additional months as compensation since I was overcharged for 5 months total. I've explained this earlier: as a studnet for the next several years, I am eligible to recieve Preimum at $6 per month. However, between 2/28/25 and 6/28/25, I was charged $12 per month. The difference in rates, here, should make me eligible for 5 additional months of Premium at a counterfactual rate of $6 per month. Okay, no worries. I understand your solution and it is appealing to me. However, a refund for 2 month only totals $24. Since I was overcharged by $6 for 5 months, a full refund for this time period would total $30 (6 * 5 = 30). Is there any way I could simply be refunded $30, since this number fully reflects the price discrepencies within the time period? Okay, no problem. If refunding $30 is impossible, an alternative could be to refund me for 2 months of premium individual (i.e. $24, as you suggested) and grant me an additional month of individual premium (since this would be equivalent to $6). Thanks for your patience. Okay, not a problem. I apologize for being preemptive That is perfect, thank you so much for your help and your willingness to compromise. Okay Yes, that works for me. Does this mean my student discount is still in tact for the next year (i.e. the discount which I renewed today), or do I have to renew it again? So this means I don't have to renew my student discount for another year, since it expires on 6/29/2026? I think that's everything. Thanks again for your help. Yes ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è Very helpful and polite.

I do not have an SD card on my device The problem is specifically this: whenever i play a playlist or an artists' musics, i heard the first one, the second, sometimes the 3rd song, all perfectly all right. But then at some point, the next song that is supposed to play just doesn't. I look at my phone, and the spinning loading icon shows up instead of the ‚ùùplay‚ùù icon. So I unlock my phone, and once i click on the ‚ùùnext‚ùù icon, the next song plays perfectly fine. I click on the ‚ùùprevious‚ùù icon, and the original song (that was loading a second ago), plays fine. My phone is charged, has internet, is up to date, ALL is good. it's just that somehow, the song doesn't get loaded when it should. It started around a month ago, I've been using Spotify for the last 10 years without a single issue. OK, cleared cache and app data from Android app manager but I can't find the com.spotify.music file (actually, i can't find the spotify folder on my device). Okay, de-installed the spotify app, cleared cache, restarting the device. re-installing, will listen to music for a few songs and will report here! Consumer_Text: i purchased an audiobook top up a few months ago. i wasn't aware i used up all those hours but apparently i did (?). how can i tell when i use up my regular allotment of monthly hours and my top up gets used? and how can i avoid doing that unintentionally? thank you i purchased an audiobook top up a few months ago. i wasn't aware i used up all those hours but apparently i did (?). how can i tell when i use up my regular allotment of monthly hours and my top up gets used? and how can i avoid doing that unintentionally? thank you I need help with something else Yes ok thank you yes, but i have one follow up question. do i get any alert/warning when i use up my monthly allowance and hours are deducted from my top-up? i don't recall ever receiving such an email after purchasing a top-up in December 2024, but I don't seem to have any top up hours remaining. Are you able to tell me when I used all my top up hours? I am not seeing a way to review historical info on the track hours page. thx thank you! i'm not seeing anything about listening history there. i also looked back in my emails and don't see anything reflecting that i used up all my top up hours ok, thanks. i have received email notifications when i ran out of audiobook listening time -- including this morning. yes please and could you also look into whether i was ever sent notification after purchasing the top up in december 2024 that i used up my monthly allowance and listening time would be taken from my top up and also whether i was ever notified that i had used up my top up hours? thank you i just confirmed i reviewed my emails and did not find any. i regularly check my junk folder, and they did not end up in there if i wasn't notified that my top up would be used (after initial purchase/use) or that i used up all my top up hours, is there any recourse in getting some of the listening time restored? i would've liked the opportunity to decide whether to use top up hours or stop listening until the following month yes, that sounds ok and is much appreciated. i guess i would just offer as feedback that providing more information about listening time including top up time would allow customers to have more control over their consumption of audiobooks thank you very much no, that's it. again, i very much appreciate your help Yes ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è no wendywtc@gmail.com

Consumer_Text: I am an artist. The label of one of my released has control over my Spotify artist page. Though he controls that specific record, he should not control my Artist profile. I want to release more music on Spotify, but now I can't. How can I reclaim my page? How can I release more music? Get access to Spotify for Artists none yes Hello Haindavi M. Can I tell about my issue? yes This is the link to my profile: https://open.spotify.com/artist/2Ip90dEqTjbUI8JIOMs7co?si=2kOlLtw8RC6O0XXa5iZm4w For now I'd only like to hear about my options, and solutions. I don't want the label to receive any type of notifications now. But I need to know what my options are as I hope to release more music in the coming season. We are in a current dispute and in no contact. Before the dispute he offered me collaborator access. But now he refused my request to reclaim the page. I understand that he controls the distribution of our record though distrokid, that is fine. But the artist profile goes beyond that record. As of now, I have no access. Of course. But could you make sure The label will not receive any type of notification now? Ok. yes this is my IG: https://www.instagram.com/karimaelfillali/ The label has its own IG: https://www.instagram.com/worldofwils/ How will I be able to get access to the profile? In due time, that is ok. But is there a way for me to reclaim the whole profile? To me it is strange that through his distribution of the EP through distrokid he got hold of my whole name/profile without my permission I prefer my email not to be seen there. Is it only for now? That you can check? When I add my email there, what will you do? When I get access, will it be as a teammember: will the label be there still? Or can I also fully reclaim? Is there no way to become the sole admin of this profile? As the label and I will part ways, they shouldn't have any insight in releases that dont fall under their control Does the label have that same power as well? Thank you for clarifying. Haindavi M. I would like to proceed with these changes later, when I am ready to make the new releases. I don't want to make any changes now, as they will be visible to the label. As we are currently in a legal process, this may create a disruption. Can I contact you again, when I am ready to release to get access to my profile? Thank you, it was very helpful. Should I ask for you next time? Great, thank you so much!

Consumer_Text: Hello! regarding the count-down pages: I plan on releasing an EP with 4 tracks or more. Prior to the Maine EP release I want to release 2 songs from there as singles. do all songs need to already be uploaded to my distro before setting all up or may the rest of the songs be uploaded later to said EP while still having the possibility to use the countdown page feature? Speak to an advisor Hello there Hey Supriya Yes thank you. Likewise No I have not uploaded the tracks yet do my distro. I wanted to clear this berforehand. So what I am asking is basically: do I need to upload the whole album in order to use de count down feature or may I gradually add the songs to my final album (EP) release and still be able to use the feature yes but would it still work? so even more concrete: I would upload 2 songs this year to be released as singles, that I also want to have on an 4 songs EP that will be released next year. the other songs would be uploaded beginning of next year. would that still work, or would that cancel the eligibility for the count down page? And will they all be landing in the same album in the end? ok. so basically using the ‚ùùwaterfall release‚ùù principle where all songs get the same ISRC code should work for gradually uploading songs to a future EP release. hope I got it right perfect. Thank you Supriya. that clears it all up no that was it. Thank you! Have a good one! Bye! Yes Very easy ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è All great

For Play_Ground And for Jan Kus, I can send you anything you would prefer Play_Ground only has an ig account and a youtube channel Ok good https://www.instagram.com/groundplaymusic?igsh=ZjkxdzhzZDZjbnk4 Here is Play_Ground‚Äôs ig If you check the posts, you can see that it‚Äôs me there (playing saxophone) :) Ok, thank you Awesome, thank you! Great I can send my website? And you will see that it‚Äôs me https://www.jankusmusic.com/about-2 No worries Thank you, you‚Äôre the best! :) I was getting worried about how I‚Äôll be able to do this. Glad I contacted you I have Play_Ground there, but Jan Kus not yet Sure One sec Got all 3 there now, yes! Thank you I have one more question How can I now ‚Äútag‚Äù Jan Kus in the releases of Slavo Rican and Play_Ground? To connect the profiles, so that it shows like: there is a saxophonist/composer Jan Kus, and these are two bands which he also leads? Ok, that‚Äôs DistroKid? I have all 3 releases there Aha, great! And then I just go to edit info or something along those lines? Ok great, Thank you for all your help! No, that would be all for today. Thank you! üôè

Consumer_Text: Continue Conversation Hello :I have a Premium Duo account and I listen to different selections when I am out jogging while my wife listens to her own selections when she's at home, either on her Iphone or on Echo Dot. I used to be able to go to Playback and take my music offline and use my library. The settings were simple but have now change and therefore I have not been able to figure out why the settings are different and everytime I try the system changes her phone or Echo Dot to what I am listening to. we both have separate accounts. What do I need to do? Where do I find security and privacy? I see Privacy and Social, not the other. Ok....Can I not do this on my phone app. Everything was simple a few months ago. I shouldn't have to go to the website. Hello???? In the past, I simply went to settings and privacy and then playback. I selected online and was able to play my library selections that I had downloaded. Thereafter, my wife could listen to whatever she wanted to. Frankly this is getting ridiculous. I should be able to do this on my phone app and not have to go through all of this BS! Are you with Spotify or somewhere else Hello???? Okay Valross, I am not happy with how you are communicating with me. I have been a long time customer with Spotify and I simply want a suitable solution. I am very happy with Spotify, but this customer service practice of having to message a person is taking way too much time. All I want to do is go to my app and solve my problem. I am computer savvy and I know what to do, as I have for years. Please solve my problem or let me talk to a supervisor! Okay, why does my wife's Iphone revert to what I'm listening considering that she has her own account? i looked at here app and confirmed that she is signed in to her account Janet Fransila . Sorry, but I have to go. I will have to deal with this later.

Consumer_Text: Hi, I wanted to express my deep disappointment in Spotify for allowing generative AI music on their platform without any kind of warning for users or way to filter it out. I personally believe generative AI has no place on Spotify and that is should be prohibited from the platform but the absolute bare minimum is that it should be required to be labeled as AI generated and that users need to have the option to block AI content. I wanted to pass along this feedback as upon learning that AI ‚ùùbands‚ùù like ‚ùùthe velvet sundown‚ùù exist on your platform without being labeled as AI has me seriously considering canceling my subscription. Offensive or inappropriate content Report explicit or offensive content Yes I don't need a response just hope that this feedback can influence policy. I'm currently looking into alternative platforms for music streaming and will likely cancel my subscription once I find my best option.

Consumer_Text: I have had an account for years, never had to log in because I never logged out. Recently it requested me to log in. So I did so with my username and it wasn't accepted. I then tried to log in with my email address and it allowed me access, but it was a completely different account. From over 600 songs to 80 and all saved content gone. Why can't I log in with my Username? Help with a different account Username and Password Continue the conversation Username and Password Chat with an advisor Yes Hi thanks for your time... armstrong.energise@gmail.com I have always logged in with my Username and Password. When I was asked to log in recently, it didn't recognise my Username and wouldn't allow me to access the account. So I tried with my email address and it took me to a completely different account. MenInKilts Ahh yes that is an old email address I used to have. I don't know. Can you wait whilst I try? No I can't access it anymore. Sorry. Can you wait or shall I come back? My contract with them ended badly and I can't access this email account. Thank you so much... But I have provided you with the Username and I have the Password, so if you were able to access the account that way, then the email address could be changed. Can this not be done? It states that the Username is not linked to a spotify account. And yet you were able to identify my account with the Username. I have never been asked to log in before either, so that was strange. Why didn't it recognise the Username, when you were able to identify it? Clearly it is my fault for not updating my email address on my spotify account, I understand that. But I just didn't think to change it. But surely this can't stop me from accessing my account, especially as it has a specifically designed access process, by username and password? You've been really helpful and I am not trying to be difficult. I simply don't want to let go of all the music and podcasts I have built up over the years, that I love. No. But thank you for explaining. I understand. And thank you for your time today. I was recently requested to log in to the account. Which I have never been asked to do before after setting it up, because I rarely logged out of it. The problem was because I had not updated my email address to a new one on the account, this was the reason I was denied access. Yet the adviser was able to identify my account. I have the password as well. I have no access to the old email address now, so the problem could not be resolved. This means I have to let go of years of building up my spotify account, which as you can imagine is very sad and frustrating.
